import re

def translate(text):
    text = text.replace(" ", "_")
    text = re.sub("[^a-zA-Z0-9_]", "", text)
    return text

print translate("The GNOME Panel")

The_GNOME_Panel

For example, if the input is "한국어" (Korean) and the output is "日本語" (Japanese), then you have to translate the first word as "한글" (Hangul), the second word as "Japanese", and so on.

input = "韩国语"
